revised_title: Investigation of Unusual Grains Resembling Wheat in Wilt-Shire
tldr: The author, William Cole, investigates unusual grains resembling wheat that fell in Wilt-Shire. He discovers that these grains are actually seeds of ivy berries, which were blown away from towers, churches, chimneys, and walls by fierce wind and hailstorms. Cole examines the grains and compares them to ivy berry seeds, confirming their identity.
